results.title: Frameworks in action: active learning
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Three teachers show their approach to “active learning” in areas of primary English, postprimary Mathematics and Drama. This is part of a series showing teachers and parents practical responses to the Frameworks approach.

results.title: Frame by frame: the art of animation
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Film Productions, Pyramid Films, Paul Burnford and Jerry Samuelson
results.brief_description: This film explores the possibilities of making a frame-by-frame, or animated film. Illustrates a variety of frame-by-frame techniques: still-picture filming (kinestasis), flicker-framing, cut-out animation, people animation (pixillation), direct images on film, and time sequence filming. This film is suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford Film Productions, Pyramid Films, Paul Burnford and Jerry Samuelson

results.title: Fragments
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Writes Silver, `These tapes can be seen as small sketches, snatches of overheard conversations, or as advertising that doesn’t sell anything.’ Fragments is an ongoing series of short tapes, each designed to be shown between other videotapes; that is, no two ‘fragments’ in the series are to be shown one after the other.

Fragments appear on the Access Overscan in this order:
0:00 to 0:59
Belong, 1994, 59 sec, color, sound
1:00 to 1:59 - break
2:00 to 2:44
Desire, 1994, 44 sec, color, sound
2:45 to 3:59 - break
4:00 to 4:34
Fly, 1994, 34 sec, color, sound
4:35 to 5:59 - break
6:00 to 6:07
Apple, 1994, 7 sec, color, sound
6:08 to 6:59 - break
7:00 to 7:14
All, 1994, 14 sec, color, sound
7:15 to 7:59 - break
8:00 to 9:10
Jump, 1994, 1:10 min, color, sound
9:11 to 9:21 - break

results.title: Fraggle songs
results.brief_description: Fraggle Rock was a very successful television series from 1983-1988 emanating from the producers of the much-loved Muppet Show but featuring a whole new cast of Jim Henson’s muppets, including Doc and his dog Sprocket, furry little creatures called Fraggles who share their home Fraggle Rock with other even smaller creatures known as the Doozers and the giant Gorgs who like to think they rule Fraggle Rock. These wonderful characters all inhabit the magical fairy-tale world of Fraggle Rock where the most amazing things can and do happen. “Fraggle songs” successfully brings together through music and song, the lovable Fraggle Rock characters in a warm and highly amusing story designed to entertain the whole family, with original music and lyrics composed by Phillip Balsam and Dennis Lee.

results.title: Fracture of the cervical spine: crutchfield tongs reduction
results.brief_description: A silent film with intertitles showing the way crutchfield tongs reduction works to cure a patient who has fractured his cervical spine after diving into shallow water. The initial operation in which the head is drilled is shown performed on a cadaver.

results.title: Fractions
results.brief_description: An animated film which introduces the symbols for halves, quarters and thirds. Clearly and simply outlines the difference between whole numbers and fractions.

results.title: Fra Diavolo
results.creator_credit: Official Films, Richfield Operatic Films, George Richfield and Francesco Cancellieri
results.brief_description: A condensed version of Aubor’s comic opera in three acts. The film preserves the dramatic continuity of the complete opera and includes the major scenes and musical passages. Photographed on the stage of the opera house of Rome, sung in Italian by La Scala Opera Company with Nino Adami in the role of Fra Diavolo.
